snippet: Sallie Mae, the student lender, and Navient, its former subsidiary, have agreed to pay $97 million to settle complaints about excessive fees and interest on loans to military service members.
abstract: Student lender Sallie Mae, and its former subsidiary Navient, agree to pay $97 million to settle complaints about excessive fees and interest on student loans to military service members.
lead_paragraph: Sallie Mae, the student lender, and Navient, its former subsidiary, have agreed to pay $97 million to settle complaints about excessive fees and interest on loans to military service members.

headline.main: Sallie Mae to Pay Fine Over Loans to Troops
